lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing package¶

Submodules¶

lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstr_iterations_temp_function module¶

class lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstr_iterations_temp_function.AbstrIterationsTempFunction¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Class for determining the number of iterations for a temperature.

This class is meant to be used in a simulated annealing algorithm. It is used to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

get_iterations(temperature)¶

Returns the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Parameters:Temperature (int or float) – The current temperature.

lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstract_cooling_function module¶

class lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstract_cooling_function.AbstractCoolingFunction¶

Bases: abc.ABC

A class that implements a cooling function for simulated annealing.

next_temperature(old_temperature)¶

Function to get the next temperature

Parameters:old_temperature (int or float) – The old temperature
Returns:The new temperature
Return type:int or float

lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function module¶

class lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function.CnstIterationsTempFunction(iterations=1000)¶

Bases: lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstr_iterations_temp_function.AbstrIterationsTempFunction

Class for determining the number of iterations for a temperature.

This class is meant to be used in a simulated annealing algorithm. It is used to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Parameters:iterations (int) – The amount of iterations for all temperatures.
_iterations¶

The amount of iterations for all temperatures. Default is 1000.

Type:int

Examples

Default behaviour:

>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function \
...     import CnstIterationsTempFunction
... # init
>>> test = CnstIterationsTempFunction()
... # tests
>>> test.get_iterations(1000)
1000
>>> test.get_iterations(359)
1000
>>> test.get_iterations(0)
1000

With 800 iterations:

>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function \
...     import CnstIterationsTempFunction
... # init
>>> test = CnstIterationsTempFunction(800)
... # tests
>>> test.get_iterations(1000)
800
>>> test.get_iterations(359)
800
>>> test.get_iterations(0)
800
get_iterations(temperature)¶

Returns the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Parameters:temperature (int or float) – The “temperature” in the simulated annealing algorithm.
Returns:The amount of iterations for the temperature. (Here always _iterations)
Return type:int

lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function module¶

class lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function.GeometricCoolingFunction(alpha=0.75)¶

Bases: lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstract_cooling_function.AbstractCoolingFunction

Implements a geometric cooling function for simulated annealing.

Parameters:alpha (float, optional) – A parameter that influences the cooling rate. Should be a positive number smaller than 1. Default is 0.75.
_alpha¶

A parameter that influences the cooling rate.

Type:float

Examples

A simple example:

>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function \
...     import GeometricCoolingFunction
>>> import math
... # init
>>> test = GeometricCoolingFunction()
... # tests
>>> test.next_temperature(1000)
750.0
>>> test.next_temperature(100)
75.0
>>> test.next_temperature(10)
7.5

An example with an alpha of 0.5:

>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function \
...     import GeometricCoolingFunction
>>> import math
... # init
>>> test = GeometricCoolingFunction(0.5)
... # tests
>>> test.next_temperature(1000)
500.0
>>> test.next_temperature(100)
50.0
>>> test.next_temperature(10)
5.0
next_temperature(old_temperature)¶

Function to get the next temperature

Parameters:old_temperature (int or float) – The old temperature.
Returns:The new temperature. This temperature is equal to:
\[\_alpha*old\_temperature\]
Return type:float

lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing module¶

class lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing.SimulatedAnnealing(problem, termination_criterion, cooling_function, iterations_for_temp_f, start_temperature=2000, minimise=True, benchmarking=False)¶

Bases: lspy.localsearch.abstract_local_search.AbstractLocalSearch

Performs a simulated annealing algorithm with the given parameters.

Parameters:
  • problem (AbstractLocalSearchProblem) – Contains all the data needed for the specific problem.
  • termination_criterion (AbstractTerminationCriterion) – Implements a termination criterion to terminate the algorithm.
  • cooling_function (AbstractCoolingFunction) – Implements the cooling function for the algorithm.
  • iterations_for_temp_f (AbstrIterationsTempFunction) – Implements a function to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.
  • start_temperature (int, optional) – The starting temperature for the simulated annealing. The default is 2000.
  • minimise (bool, optional) – Will minimise if this parameter is True, maximise if it is False. The default is True.
  • benchmarking (bool, optional) – Should be True if one wishes benchmarks to be kept, should be False if one wishes no benchmarks to be made. Default is False.
_problem¶

Contains all the data needed for the specific problem.

Type:AbstractLocalSearchProblem
_termination_criterion¶

Implements a termination criterion to terminate the algorithm.

Type:AbstractTerminationCriterion
_cooling_function¶

Implements the cooling function for the algorithm.

Type:AbstractCoolingFunction
_iterations_for_temp_f¶

Implements a function to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Type:AbstrIterationsTempFunction
_start_temperature¶

The start “temperature”.

Type:int
_temperature¶

The current “temperature”.

Type:int
_acceptance_function¶

The acceptance function used.

Type:SimulatedAnnealingAcceptanceFunction
_is_improvement¶

Function used to determine if a certain delta value is an improvement or equal to the current value.

_is_better¶

Function used to determine if a certain value is an improvement.

data¶

Data useable for benchmarking. Will be None if no benchmarks are made.

Type:list of tuple
_data_append¶

Function to append new data-points to data. Will do nothing if no benchmarks are made.

Examples

Minimising example:

>>> import numpy
>>> import random
>>> from lspy.localsearch.move.tsp_array_swap import TspArraySwap
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing \
...     import SimulatedAnnealing
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function \
...     import GeometricCoolingFunction
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function \
...     import CnstIterationsTempFunction
>>> from lspy.evaluation.tsp_evaluation_function \
...     import TspEvaluationFunction
>>> from locsearch.termination.min_temperature_termination_criterion \
...     import MinTemperatureTerminationCriterion
>>> from locsearch.problem.array_problem import ArrayProblem
... # seed random
... # (used here to always get the same output, this obviously is not
... #                                  needed in your implementation.)
>>> random.seed(0)
... # init problem
>>> distance_matrix = numpy.array(
... [[0, 2, 5, 8],
...  [2, 0, 4, 1],
...  [5, 4, 0, 7],
...  [8, 1, 7, 0]])
>>> size = distance_matrix.shape[0]
>>> move = TspArraySwap(size)
>>> evaluation = TspEvaluationFunction(distance_matrix, move)
>>> problem = ArrayProblem(evaluation, move, size)
... # init termination criterion
>>> termination_criterion = MinTemperatureTerminationCriterion()
... # init cooling function
>>> cooling_func = GeometricCoolingFunction()
... # init CnstIterationsTempFunction
... # (determines amount of itertions in function of the temperature)
>>> i_for_temp = CnstIterationsTempFunction()
... # init SimulatedAnnealing
>>> algorithm = SimulatedAnnealing(problem, termination_criterion,
...                                cooling_func, i_for_temp)
... # run algorithm
>>> algorithm.run()
Results(best_order=array([0, 2, 3, 1]), best_value=15, data=None)

Maximising example, note that the distance matrix is different:

>>> import numpy
>>> import random
>>> from lspy.localsearch.move.tsp_array_swap import TspArraySwap
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing \
...     import SimulatedAnnealing
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function \
...     import GeometricCoolingFunction
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function \
...     import CnstIterationsTempFunction
>>> from lspy.evaluation.tsp_evaluation_function \
...     import TspEvaluationFunction
>>> from lspy.termination.min_temperature_termination_criterion \
...     import MinTemperatureTerminationCriterion
>>> from locsearch.problem.array_problem import ArrayProblem
... # seed random
... # (used here to always get the same output, this obviously is not
... #                                  needed in your implementation.)
>>> random.seed(0)
... # init problem
>>> distance_matrix = numpy.array(
... [[0, 8, 5, 2],
...  [8, 0, 4, 7],
...  [5, 4, 0, 1],
...  [2, 7, 1, 0]])
>>> size = distance_matrix.shape[0]
>>> move = TspArraySwap(size)
>>> evaluation = TspEvaluationFunction(distance_matrix, move)
>>> problem = ArrayProblem(evaluation, move, size)
... # init termination criterion
>>> termination_criterion = MinTemperatureTerminationCriterion()
... # init cooling function
>>> cooling_func = GeometricCoolingFunction()
... # init CnstIterationsTempFunction
... # (determines amount of itertions in function of the temperature)
>>> i_for_temp = CnstIterationsTempFunction()
... # init SimulatedAnnealing
>>> algorithm = SimulatedAnnealing(
...     problem, termination_criterion,
...     cooling_func, i_for_temp, minimise=False)
... # run algorithm
>>> algorithm.run()
Results(best_order=array([0, 2, 3, 1]), best_value=21, data=None)
reset()¶

Resets the object back to it’s state after init.

Raises:NotImplementedError – If the problem or termination criterion have no reset method implemented.

Examples

Minimising example, reset after run:

>>> import numpy
>>> import random
>>> from locsearch.localsearch.move.tsp_array_swap import TspArraySwap
>>> from locsearch.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing \
...     import SimulatedAnnealing
>>> from lspy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function \
...     import GeometricCoolingFunction
>>> from locsearch.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function \
...     import CnstIterationsTempFunction
>>> from lspy.evaluation.tsp_evaluation_function \
...     import TspEvaluationFunction
>>> from lspy.termination.min_temperature_termination_criterion \
...     import MinTemperatureTerminationCriterion
>>> from locsearch.problem.array_problem import ArrayProblem
... # seed random
... # (used here to always get the same output, this obviously is not
... #                                  needed in your implementation.)
>>> random.seed(0)
... # init problem
>>> distance_matrix = numpy.array(
... [[0, 2, 5, 8],
...  [2, 0, 4, 1],
...  [5, 4, 0, 7],
...  [8, 1, 7, 0]])
>>> size = distance_matrix.shape[0]
>>> move = TspArraySwap(size)
>>> evaluation = TspEvaluationFunction(distance_matrix, move)
>>> problem = ArrayProblem(evaluation, move, size)
... # init termination criterion
>>> termination_criterion = MinTemperatureTerminationCriterion()
... # init cooling function
>>> cooling_func = GeometricCoolingFunction()
... # init CnstIterationsTempFunction
... # (determines amount of itertions in function of the temperature)
>>> i_for_temp = CnstIterationsTempFunction()
... # init SimulatedAnnealing
>>> algorithm = SimulatedAnnealing(problem, termination_criterion,
...                                cooling_func, i_for_temp)
... # state before running
>>> algorithm._start_temperature
2000
>>> algorithm._temperature
2000
>>> algorithm._problem._order
array([0, 1, 2, 3])
>>> algorithm._termination_criterion.keep_running()
True
>>> # run algorithm
>>> algorithm.run()
Results(best_order=array([0, 2, 3, 1]), best_value=15, data=None)
>>> # tests reset
>>> # before reset
>>> algorithm._start_temperature
2000
>>> algorithm._temperature
8.456565170490649
>>> algorithm._problem._order
array([0, 2, 1, 3])
>>> algorithm._termination_criterion.keep_running()
False
>>> # reset
>>> algorithm.reset()
... # after reset
>>> algorithm._start_temperature
2000
>>> algorithm._temperature
2000
>>> algorithm._problem._order
array([0, 1, 2, 3])
>>> algorithm._termination_criterion.keep_running()
True
run()¶

Starts running the simulated annealing algorithm.

Returns:
  • best_order (numpy.ndarray) – The best found order.
  • best_value (int or float) – The evaluation value of the best found order.
  • data (None or collections.namedtuple) – Data useable for benchmarking. If no benchmarks were made, it will be None. The namedtuple contains the following data in numpy.ndarrays: time, iteration, temperature, value, best_value
